Industrial Resource that was transported or earned in Skirmishes is accumulated in storage.
• Industrial Resource is used to prepare Reserves (exception—storage of the Command Center) and to upgrade structures. • To fill storage, transport Industrial Resource or earn it in Skirmishes. • If the structure is damaged, Industrial Resource is first spent to fill the durability bar and then accumulated in storage. • Industrial Resource can be earned in Skirmishes only by garrison members of the structure.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/8bitsKarl/desc
data.value: "...and from April 1 through April 15, 2014 they brought me back to my childhood and entrusted me with a huge gray Karl mortar. And it had 8-bit graphics. Just 8-bit, Karl!

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/DICEAwards2014/desc
data.value: February 7, 2014: World of Tanks wins the "Online Game of the Year" award at the D.I.C.E Awards 2014.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/DogHouse/desc
data.value: Your canine chief of security temporarily lives here, guarding your vehicles. However, he also strongly advises that you take all the necessary precautions to keep your account secure.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/DragonRidgeMap/desc
data.value: An oriental-themed map with a very complex terrain. We had to remove it in version 0.8.4 because the Dragon called and said he wanted his ridge back.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/E25/desc
data.value: German Tier VII tank destroyer. Removed from the Store in version 0.9.5, and is now seeking vengeance in battle.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/EGA2011/desc
data.value: August 15, 2011: World of Tanks receives the "Best European Online Game" award at European Games Award.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/Fallout/desc
data.value: Dominate the battlefield and become the domineering team, make the enemy fall like dominoes, and determinedly deliver flags to prove your dominion. Available in version 0.9.8.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/FirstApril2015/desc
data.value: ... and now, the weather forecast for April 1, 2015: expect intermittent clouds, strong winds, and a showering of suitcases.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/Globe/desc
data.value: • August 12, 2010 marked the game's official release on the Russian server. • March 15, 2011: the game was released in China. • April 12, 2011—World of Tanks was released for the North American and European servers. • April 27, 2012: the game was released in Vietnam. • December 27, 2012 saw the official launch of the Singapore server. • December 27, 2012: the game was officially released in South Korea. • January 19, 2014: more than 1,114,000 concurrent players fought battles on the RU region servers.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/GoldenJoystick2012/desc
data.value:
October 26, 2012: World of Tanks receives the "Best Online Game" award at the Golden Joystick Awards 2012.
By the way, the trophy looks awesome!

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/GoldenJoystick2013/desc
data.value:
October 25, 2013: World of Tanks receives the "Best Online Game" award at the Golden Joystick Awards 2013.
By the way, the trophy looks awesome!

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/GuinnessRecord/desc
data.value: January 23, 2011: World of Tanks sets the Guinness World Record for the number of concurrent players on one MMO game server, with a total of 91,311 players online at the same time.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/KRI2010/desc
data.value: May 16, 2010: World of Tanks receives the "Best Client-Based Online Game" award at the KRI-2010.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/KRI2011/desc
data.value: May 14, 2011: World of Tanks receives the "Best Game" award at the KRI-2011.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/KV/desc
data.value: Soviet Tier V heavy tank. Smelted into KV-1 and KV-2 in version 0.7.3.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/KV5/desc
data.value: Soviet Tier VIII heavy tank. Removed from the Store and made into a museum exhibit in version 0.7.5 due to numerous complaints received from Radio Operators.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/Napilnik/desc
data.value: A mythical and legendary artifact used by the Game Balance department to magically fine-tune every vehicle in the game.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/NationalLeader/desc
data.value: November 25, 2011: World of Tanks receives the "National Leader" award at the national voting stage of the Runet Prize 2011 ceremony.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/PortMap/desc
data.value: The most lively map in the game. Removed in version 0.8.11 because sea merchants complained that constant tank battles disrupted their trade routes and scared their customers.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/PzKpfw38H735/desc
data.value: A trophy French light tank with a really long name and service record in the German army. Removed from the Store in version 0.7.1.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/PzKptwB2740/desc
data.value: Trophy French heavy tank in German service. Demilitarized and removed from the Store in version 0.7.1. It was the best vehicle for training your Radio Operators.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/RuinbergInFireMap/desc
data.value: The dark and dreary version of the Ruinberg. Removed from the game in version 0.9.5 due to its excessive amount of gloom per square meter.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/SeverogorskMap/desc
data.value: The coldest map in the game. Removed in version 0.9.5 because the severe elements made the fuel in players' vehicles freeze, forcing them to stay at the base for the whole battle.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/Sturmtiger/desc
data.value: Will be introduced in the next update... or not.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/T23/desc
data.value: Tier VIII U.S. medium tank. Went to get some exercise in version 0.6.5. Returned a bit later as a reward for activities on the Global Map, having shed a tier and changed his name to T23E2.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/T502/desc
data.value: A blazingly fast Tier VI Soviet light tank. Retired in version 0.8.7, and brought his protégé, the apathetic MT-25, to replace him in battles.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/TankFootball/desc
data.value: "...the T-62A has the ball! Unbelievable! He is heading for the goal... hit! and... track destroyed—he is immobilized..." Such heated football matches were pretty common from June 12 through July 13, 2014.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/TankRace/desc
data.value: Ladies and Gentlemen, start your engines! Push that accelerator pedal to the limit and get the Tank Racing Champion trophy! In the fall of 2014, enjoy the atmosphere and experience a racing championship.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/Type59/desc
data.value: Tier VIII Chinese medium tank. Admit it, you have been dreaming about getting this tank ever since 0.7.1.

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/WhiteTiger/desc
data.value: From May 3 through May 31, 2012, there was a legend of the ghost of a vehicle appearing on the battlefield, and only those whose spirit was strong, could banish that vile spirit from our world (of tanks).

data.name: hangar3dScene/5thAnniversary/WinterBattle/desc
data.value: In the winter of 2015, the Mammoths, Arctic Foxes, and Polar Bears grappled in the heated Winter Showdown to find out who among them was the true king of beasts.

Wide range Suitable for modern external sound systems and headphones that support full audio range output, as well as for certain Hi-Fi sound systems. The difference between the loudest and quietest sounds is more notable.
Narrow range Suitable for small sound systems, laptop speakers, and low-end headphones. Ensures comfortable gameplay at night. The difference between the loudest and quietest sounds is less notable.

Headphones Adjusts the in-game sound for headphones.

data.name: squadWindow/infoIcon/techRestrictions/body2

data.name: tank_params/desc/aimingTime
data.value: Time it takes for the aiming circle diameter to decrease by 60%.

data.name: tank_params/desc/chassisRotationSpeed
data.value: Speed of hull traverse about its axis, and speed of changing direction in motion (maneuverability).

data.name: tank_params/desc/circularVisionRadius
data.value: The current View Range of your vehicle. No enemy vehicles can be spotted at a distance exceeding 445 m. Further increase of the View Range allows you to more easily spot enemy vehicles within the 445 m radius.

data.name: tank_params/desc/clipFireRate
data.value: Time between firing the last shell in the magazine and loading the new magazine. / Time between firing a shell and loading the next shell in the same magazine. / Number of shells in one magazine.

data.name: tank_params/desc/damage
data.value: Damage caused by a standard shell upon penetrating enemy armor.

data.name: tank_params/desc/damageAvg
data.value: Average damage caused by a standard shell upon penetrating enemy armor.

data.name: tank_params/desc/damageAvgPerMinute
data.value: Potential damage to an enemy vehicle per minute if all shots penetrate its armor.

data.name: tank_params/desc/enginePower
data.value: This parameter affects vehicle acceleration, top speed, and hull traverse speed.

data.name: tank_params/desc/enginePowerPerTon
data.value: This parameter affects vehicle acceleration and performance on different terrain types.

data.name: tank_params/desc/explosionRadius
data.value: Burst radius after the HE shell explosion.

data.name: tank_params/desc/gunRotationSpeed
data.value: Degrees of gun traverse (vertical and horizontal) per second within the arc of fire when the hull is stationary.

data.name: tank_params/desc/gunYawLimits
data.value: Maximum angles for horizontal gun traverse (to the left and right of the default position) when the hull is stationary.

data.name: tank_params/desc/hullArmor
data.value: Thickness of hull armor: front / sides / rear respectively.

data.name: tank_params/desc/invisibilityMovingFactor
data.value: Shows the concealment of a vehicle in motion. The higher the parameter, the more concealed the vehicle. The following parameters are indicated: for a moving vehicle / for a moving vehicle after firing.

data.name: tank_params/desc/invisibilityStillFactor
data.value: Shows the concealment of a motionless vehicle. The higher the parameter, the more concealed the vehicle. The following parameters are indicated: for a stationary vehicle / for a stationary vehicle after firing.

data.name: tank_params/desc/piercingPower
data.value: Thickness of armor that can be penetrated by a standard shell adjusted for shell normalization.

data.name: tank_params/desc/pitchLimits
data.value: Maximum angles of gun depression/elevation with respect to its default position.

data.name: tank_params/desc/radioDistance
data.value: Communication—sharing information with allies about the positions of vehicles. The communication range for each individual vehicle is represented by a circle with a radius that is set for this parameter. When several circles overlap, information is shared at any distance if there are enough vehicles in the communication chain.

data.name: tank_params/desc/relativeArmor
data.value: A set of parameters that shows the vehicle resilience to damage caused.

data.name: tank_params/desc/relativeCamouflage
data.value: A set of parameters that show the effectiveness of concealment when your vehicle is stationary, moving, and firing. Applied camouflage increases the concealment parameter.

data.name: tank_params/desc/relativeMobility
data.value: A set of parameters that show how quickly the vehicle can change its position on the battlefield.

data.name: tank_params/desc/relativePower
data.value: A set of parameters that show the effectiveness of destroying enemy vehicles.

data.name: tank_params/desc/relativeVisibility
data.value: A set of parameters that show the effectiveness of spotting enemy vehicles.

data.name: tank_params/desc/reloadTimeSecs
data.value: Time it takes to reload the gun after firing.

data.name: tank_params/desc/shotDispersionAngle
data.value: Gun dispersion characterized by the maximum shell deviation from the aiming point at a distance of 100 m.

data.name: tank_params/desc/speedLimits
data.value: Vehicle speed as it is defined in its technical characteristics.

data.name: tank_params/desc/turretArmor
data.value: Thickness of turret armor: front / sides / rear respectively.

data.name: tank_params/desc/turretRotationSpeed
data.value: Degrees of turret traverse per second.

data.name: tank_params/desc/turretYawLimits
data.value: Maximum turret traverse angles relative to the longitudinal axis of a vehicle when the hull is stationary.

data.name: tank_params/desc/vehicleWeight
data.value: This parameter determines the load limit of the vehicle, where the load consists of modules and equipment. Weight also determines the effectiveness of ramming.

data.name: tanksFilter/counter/close/body
data.value: Click to reset filter settings to default.

data.value: Go to the Sweden Tech Tree

data.name: vehicleParams/penalty/tankmanDifferentVehicle/template

data.name: vehicleParams/possibleBonuses/desc

data.name: vehicleParams/warning/tankmanIsOut
data.value: Crew incomplete. %(tankmen)s missing. The indicated parameter is relevant for a crew trained to 100%%.

data.name: vehiclePreview/crew/commander
data.value: Influences the distance at which enemy vehicles are spotted (%(paramName)s). Improves crew performance. The Commander adds %(crewPercents)s to major qualifications of all other crew members per %(commanderPercents)s of the Commander's major qualification.

data.name: vehiclePreview/crew/driver
data.value: Influences the vehicle's hull traverse speed, i.e. vehicle maneuverability (%(paramName)s).

data.name: vehiclePreview/crew/gunner
data.value: Influences gun aiming time, turret traverse speed, gun traverse speed, and dispersion at 100 m (%(paramName)s).

data.name: vehiclePreview/crew/loader
data.value: Influences rate of fire, average damage per minute, and reload time (%(paramName)s).

data.name: vehiclePreview/crew/radioman
data.value: Influences the vehicle's maximum signal range, which determines the distance at which enemy vehicles are displayed on the minimap (%(paramName)s).

data.name: awardItem/premium/body

data.name: awardItem/slots/body

data.name: awardItem/tankmenXP/body

data.name: skills/brotherhood/descr
data.value: Improves major qualifications and all skills for the entire crew. This perk is cumulative with the effects of Improved Ventilation, Extra Combat Rations, Chocolate, Case of Cola, Pudding and Tea, Strong Coffee, Improved Combat Rations, Onigiri, Buchty, and Coffee with Buns.

data.name: skills/camouflage/descr
data.value: Reduces vehicle visibility. This skill is cumulative with the effects of Camouflage (for the corresponding types of maps) and a Camouflage Net.

data.name: skills/commander_eagleEye/descr
data.value: Increases Maximum View Range. This skill is more effective if observation devices are damaged, or when combined with Situational Awareness, Coated Optics, and Binocular Telescope.

data.name: skills/driver_badRoadsKing/descr
data.value: Reduces ground resistance when driving on soft and moderately soft terrain. Lower ground resistance increases vehicle maneuverability and acceleration. This skill is cumulative with the effects of Additional Grousers.

data.name: skills/driver_virtuoso/descr
data.value: Increases vehicle traverse speed. This skill is cumulative with the effects of Additional Grousers, Lend-Lease Oil, Quality Oil, Removed Speed Governor, 100-octane Gasoline, and 105-octane Gasoline. Important! This skill increases gun dispersion on hull traverse.

data.name: skills/radioman_finder/descr
data.value: Increases Maximum View Range. If two Radio Operators have the skill, only the higher rating is effective. The skill is cumulative with the effects of Recon, Coated Optics and Binocular Telescope.

data.name: personalMissions/awards/camouflage/body
data.value:
A set of three Camouflage patterns (summer, winter, and desert).
Awarded when completing all operations with honors and can be applied to any vehicle of the nation to which the reward vehicle belongs.
To find the unique Camouflage patterns, use the Missions filtering option in the vehicle's Exterior screen.

data.name: personalMissions/awards/camouflageAll/body
data.value: A set of three Camouflage patterns (summer, winter, and desert). Can be applied to the award vehicle for free or purchased for any other vehicle of the same nation.

data.name: personalMissions/awards/camouflageNation/body
data.value: A set of three Camouflage patterns (summer, winter, and desert). Can be purchased for any vehicle of the same nation as the award vehicle.

data.name: personalMissions/awards/camouflageOnly/body
data.value: A set of three Camouflage patterns (summer, winter, and desert). Can be applied to any vehicle of the same nation as the award vehicle.
